newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia's Saeaga Airlines to buy 10 planes - paper.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia's Saeaga Airlines to buy 10 planes - paper.

text.p: Malaysian domestic carrier Saeaga Airlines will buy 10 Boeing 737-700 planes for 1.1 billion ringgit, The Star newspaper reported on Friday.
It quoted Saeaga Airlines chairman Ting Pek Khiing, who said, "We will be signing a deal with Boeing next month for the planes, which cost about 110 million ringgit each."
He said delivery of the planes will begin by February, and that the acquisition will enable the airline to start international routes beginning from East Asia to Taiwan and Australia.
Presently, Saeaga Airlines only flies domestic routes. It is 20 percent owned by Ekran Bhd, of which Ting is executive chairman.
Company officials were unavailable for immediate comment.
